resources.string: How to Play Minesweeper: A Comprehensive Guide

Minesweeper is an exciting and strategic puzzle game that challenges your logic and problem-solving skills. The goal is simple: clear the grid of hidden mines without triggering any of them. Below, you’ll find a detailed guide explaining the rules, gameplay mechanics, and features of the app

The Tiles
 The game grid consists of numerous tiles. Each tile can hide a mine or be a safe spot. Your job is to figure out which tiles are safe to click and which ones to flag as potential mines.

 Numbers on the Tiles
 When you reveal a tile, it may display a number from 1 to 8. These numbers will tell you how many mines are hidden in the tiles immediately surrounding that one.
 For example, if you reveal a tile with the number "3," it means there are exactly three mines hidden in the eight surrounding tiles (3x3 around that specific tile).

Starting the Game
 Begin by tapping on any tile. The first click is always safe, ensuring you can start exploring without triggering a mine. This initial click often reveals a larger section of the grid, giving you a starting point.


Interpreting the Numbers
 Use the numbers on the revealed tiles to deduce where the mines are located. For example, if a tile displays "1" and there’s only one unrevealed tile adjacent to it, that unrevealed tile must contain a mine.


Marking Mines
 If you suspect a tile contains a mine, long-press it to mark it with a flag. Be cautious with your flags. Incorrectly marking tiles can lead to mistakes later on in the game.


Revealing Safe Tiles
 Tap on tiles you believe are safe to reveal more of the grid. Continue this process while avoiding tiles that may contain mines.


Clearing the Grid
 The game is won when all safe tiles are revealed and/or all mines are correctly flagged.

Triggering a Mine
 If you accidentally reveal a tile that contains a mine, the game ends immediately. The grid will display all the mine locations to show what went wrong.


Incorrect Flags
 While incorrect flag placement doesn’t end the game immediately, it can lead to errors in your deduction process, increasing the chances of revealing a mine later. However, you can undo a tile marked as a flag by long-pressing the tile again.

Our app offers three levels of difficulty to accommodate players of all skill levels:


Easy (8x8 grid, 10 mines)
 This level features a small grid with only a few mines. It is s perfect for beginners who are learning the mechanics of the game.


Medium (16x16 grid, 40 mines)
 A medium-sized grid with a moderate number of mines. This level provides a balanced challenge for intermediate players.


Hard: (30x30 grid, 120 mines)
 The hardest level offers a large grid densely packed with mines. It’s designed for experienced players who want to test their skills to the fullest.


Each difficulty level offers a unique gameplay experience, so feel free to experiment and challenge yourself.

Start from the Edges
 Begin by clicking tiles near the edges or corners. These often provide clues that help you deduce the layout of the grid.


Look for Patterns
 Common number patterns, like a "1" adjacent to an empty row of tiles, can help you identify safe areas.


Use Flags Wisely
 Flagging tiles that you suspect contain mines can prevent accidental clicks, but avoid overflagging, as this might mislead your strategy.


Practice Logic
 Minesweeper is all about logical deduction. Use the information from revealed tiles to guide your decisions.

Minesweeper App saves your performance after each game, allowing you to track your progress over time. Here’s some of what is recorded:

Total Games Played: See how many games you’ve completed across all difficulty levels.
 Wins and Losses: Track how often you successfully clear the grid versus how often you hit a mine.
 Average Time: Monitor the average time it takes you to complete a game.
 Best Times: Each difficulty level records your fastest completion time, giving you something to strive for.

You can view these statistics in the app and use them as motivation to improve your gameplay and strategy.

Minesweeper is more than just a game. It’s a mental workout that sharpens your problem-solving skills and rewards careful thought and planning. Whether you’re a beginner exploring the game for the first time or an experienced player aiming for record times, there’s always something new to enjoy.\n\n
So, dive in, explore the grid, and have fun!
